title: Boards Org Update + New Sub-Boards
body:
Earlier this year we [kicked off a discussion](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/site-feedback/Ep4t0zPw-lets-talk-about-the-boards) with you all around the continued evolution of the NA boards, covering a whole bunch of sub-topics regarding what the Boards are and where they’re going. In addition to some conversations and updates around things like [moderation](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/site-feedback/gQYTAEMl-letos-talk-about-boards-moderation), we had multiple chats with you around sub-board / sidebar organization - [part one](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/site-feedback/Hx8p6GoX-letos-talk-boards-organization) & [part two](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/site-feedback/bWE8wUIE-lets-talk-boards-org-part-two).

TL;DR - We laid out various long-brewing concerns, mostly regarding excessive sub-board fragmentation and massive traffic imbalances between a few heavyweight sub-boards and the rest of the pack. This causes a ton of interesting conversations to be all but invisible to the vast majority, and is one of the main issues causing the Boards front page to sometimes appear stagnant. At the same time, we recognize the value even the smallest board communities can bring to the community-at-large, so we want a solution that gives those topics clear new homes while increasing visibility and evening out sub-board disparity. We proposed new organization centered around a smaller number of use-case focussed sub-boards (e.g., NA LFG and Riot Plz!), where what you were trying to do would matter more than specific topical accuracy when choosing a sub-board.

Many were receptive to some of the proposed changes, while others expressed concerns around potential loss of identity in cases like Story & Art and General Discussion. We do feel these concerns are both solvable and necessary in the name of fixing the Boards’ long-term organizational foundation, however, you raised valid points about needing better discovery options for finding specific content. In response to your feedback, we decided to temporarily hold off any significant changes to sub-board organization while investigating tech options (e.g., tagging / filtering). Since then, we’ve continued our behind-the-scenes work while focusing on other Boards improvements (e.g., more visible moderation, some early mobile stuff), though there’s still tons of work we’d like to do. 

Recently, two cool new opportunities popped up that we’d like to roll out to you as soon as possible. The first is a new **Player Behavior & Moderation** sub-board, meant to provide players a dedicated place for discussing behavior measures (both in-game and on the Boards) as well as more easily getting in-touch with Rioters to have conversations about disciplinary actions. 

The second is a little more novel - the Gameplay team would like to pilot a space (tentatively termed the **Dev Corner**) in which Rioters can kick off set-piece discussions with players around topics past and present. Posting new threads would be limited to Rioters, so the place is going to be specifically built around designers proactively reaching out to talk about projects they’re taking on, state of the game updates, retrospective dev blogs, or even regular ‘office hours’ to shoot the shit.

Of course, adding these two Boards only adds to our sub-board overload issue. With that in mind, we’re bundling these additions with some of the **more minor** Boards org consolidation and sidebar improvements we’ve previously proposed. To be clear, **we’re not touching any of the main sub-boards or General Discussion at this time** (just a couple minor title edits for clarity), and are entirely focused on redistributing conversations and content from some of the most egregiously underused sub-boards. The full changelist:

**Removals**

* Tips & Tricks (now part of Gameplay)
* Maps & Modes (now part of Gameplay)
* Sound & Music (now part of Story, Art, & Sound)
* Community Creations (now part of Concepts & Creations)
* League Videos (split between various sub-boards)
* Fantasy LCS (removed from sidebar, still active / reachable through Fantasy LCS site)
* Announcements (simply duplicates news content & comments so cleaning up the redundancy)

**Title Changes (for clarity / inclusiveness given removals)**

* Gameplay & Balance > Gameplay
* Story & Art > Story, Art, & Sound
* Skins & Champion Concepts > Concepts & Creations

The sidebar will be updated to reflect these changes and group sub-boards a little more clearly into conversation spaces, “red-zones,” and utility spaces. Finally, we’ll be posting **updated Universal Rules** (mostly aimed at greater clarity, no significant rule changes) and moving them to the sidebar to free up some sticky space. Once we roll out the update, you can expect the sidebar to look something like this:

http://i.imgur.com/4ALn2IG.png

*(Clarity on the rules DO YOU GET IT!?!?)*

A note on execution - the removed boards will still exist for the foreseeable future, they’ll just be locked to posting and removed from the sideboard. This should give players the ability to copy any in-progress conversations located on inactive sub-boards over to new locations where desired.

We’re currently targeting these updates for **11 AM PST, Wednesday Oct. 28.** Several members of the Boards team are around to chat about these updates, so feel free to share any thoughts or questions!

> [{quoted}](name=LegacyofTable,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=Pj5Lb5G4,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2015-10-27T01:53:21.382+0000)
>
> Player Behavior and Moderation? Is that gonna be kinda like the new Tribunal, or just general conversation about how we can improve players behavior?

This section will be focusing on discussions regarding the current or upcoming player behavior initiatives, disciplinary actions taken to accounts, and boards moderation.
Why was it decided to put that in a section separate from the other primary discussion areas?

Player Behavior is an area of discussion that has a pretty different flavor from the rest of the boards, since there are a lot of included topics and it'll involve a significant number of Player Support-esque inquiries.  

Do you feel like PB&M would be better suited as part of something else?  If so, why?
It's still an area of conversation rather than a "helpdesk" kind of feature, that's why I was curious as to what the reasoning was. I guess it borders the line between "conversation" and "support."

I like your comment on the line it's bordering, I think that's accurate.  So far it's been a pretty solid combination of the two, though we're looking to expand more on the idea of discussion in PB&M. :)

I am a fan. It makes a lot more sense and I will say it's definitely a step in the right direction. The Dev Corner is particularly good imho, as it will consolidate the MASSIVE gameplay Q+A posts.

That being said I am still a bit miffed that skin concepts are being bundled in with champion concepts still. Now, granted, there are many additions like tags and filters that could completely solve that problem and this doesn't make it any worse than the current, so it's just a personal nit-pick really.

Thumbs up, but need to see more before I get too excited.

The reasoning makes a bit more sense if you think of them as "Community Creation" labels. You have a level of experience with champion concepts that a lot of other community members do not, but for the layman it's easier to have them grouped up under the aforementioned category.

True true. 

When it comes down to it, it's really just the fact that champion concepts are by nature the most 'dense' frequent post on the Boards and their getting paired with some of the least dense posts (i.e. one-line skin ideas). Categorically it makes perfect sense I agree, but in practice it throws a lot of things off. And yes, you are 100% correct that anyone not active in the concepts board would probably not realize that, nor do I expect them to. It's just the nature of the posts and a relatively unique problem here as well.

As far as this change goes it's neither here nor there, it doesn't make the problem worse in any way and actually may improve them slightly as it's implying more of a "creation" than just rattling off an idea.

I love the idea of the Dev Corner! Providing a space for Rioters to discuss potentially touchy subjects on their own terms rather than trying to insert themselves into already heated threads should hopefully allow for some really good discussion.

I know it can be tricky to accurately predict when projects finish, but do you have a projected timeline for when a filtering system will be available? I love many parts of the Boards, but it would be a lot more enjoyable if I could simply prevent one or two particular sub-boards from turning up in my feed.

Dev Corner's gonna be janky as hell, but what you're talking about perfectly summarizes why it's interesting to pursue. I'd love for devs to be able to weigh in on a potentially contentious issue quickly and have the conversation go from there.

It's definitely an interesting idea; I'm sure there'll always be that "FIX THE SERVERS EVEN THOUGH YOU'RE AN ARTIST" guy, but seeing as only rioters can post on it, that problem might be alleviated some.

But then I just like to see the inner workings of game design, so having a rioter come out and say "Hey what are your thoughts on [X] champ's story" or maybe getting a "Give us feedback on [new thing]!" sounds great.

Unfortunately we don't have a timeline for it right now. 

TLDR: it's been difficult to get development time allocated, but we're exploring additional ways to get the work done. As soon as we can give you some more details we definitely will :).

Why is Story and Art (an already awkward union, as people interested in lore probably don't care as much about art, and people who care about art probably arent looking for lore when they go to an art board) now having music added to it? If I want to read posts about lore and the recent event or such, I don't want to sift through all the music and art to get to what I actually want.

I think it generally ties together as "Questions/Feedback/Discussion about things Riot has made" vs the "Look at new things I made!" of Concepts and Creations. I personally suspect that fan-fic type stuff will move to Concepts and Creations rather than stay with Story, Art and Sound.

That, and there's also the simple fact that besides the occasional feedback on a champion lore update most lore-related posts are going to be fan-made with Riot's new stance on Runeterra (no summoners or IoW...yada yada), so it's probably a fair assumption that the 'Story' bit isn't going to be terribly frequent.

What the hell does story have to do with art and sound?
When you think of lore do you think of sound effects and in game art?
What they have in common is "stuff made by Riot" as oppose to "stuff made by fans" (Concepts and Creations). In general, all of them form a background to the game itself.

The boards still don't have a tagging or filtering system yet, right? Then won't merging the smaller sub-boards into larger ones drown out less popular discussions? You acknowledged "needing better discovery options for finding specific content" before combining sub-boards, yet seem to have immediately disregarded that. Combining less-trafficked boards together is certainly understandable, but without filtering tools, it just becomes that much harder to get niche discussions started.

As a specific example, I frequent Maps & Modes because I'm mainly interested in discussions about non-SR maps. The vast majority of the Gameplay sub-board, however, deals with SR gameplay. It doesn't seem feasible to manually comb through a deluge of topics about SR in search of that one discussion about TT/Dom/ARAM. Could you suggest a solution here? As things stand, I feel like the boards are going to be mostly unusable to me for the foreseeable future.
gimme dat dev corner. that sounds right up my alley.
